hero.title: KBG — Bio × AI Club
hero.subtitle: We prototype living systems with code, wet-lab assays, data stories, and immersive visuals.
hero.description: From CRISPR design studios to protein-folding sprints, we explore how machine intelligence can accelerate biology. Join us for weekly build nights, lightning talks, and collaborative research that blends molecules with models.

highlights.title: 18 active builds
highlights.text: Genomics, synthetic biology, bio-robotics, and narrative design teams iterating every week.

highlights.title: 42 workshops hosted
highlights.text: CRISPR primers, RNA-Seq pipelines, microscopy ML, and shader art for scientific storytelling.

highlights.title: 6 partner labs
highlights.text: Joint programs with biotech startups, hospital partners, and IIT Mandi research groups.

sections.title: Why Bio × AI — now
sections.copy: Sequencing costs are dropping, simulation fidelity is rising, and machine learning can parse complex biological signals faster than ever. KBG helps students cross the boundary between the wet lab and the GPU by pairing domain experts with creative technologists.

sections.title: Studio-based learning
sections.copy: Each eight-week studio cycles through problem framing, assays, data capture, modelling, and storytelling. You will ship artifacts every sprint: lab protocols, datasets, dashboards, VR scenes, or policy briefs.
bullets: Shader driven explainers for molecular processes
Ethics critiques and community feedback sessions

sections.title: Shared infrastructure
sections.copy: Members access a shared equipment pool, cloud GPU credits, DNA synthesis support, and design systems for communicating results. You will never prototype alone.

tracks.title: Wet Lab ↔ Data Lab

tracks.title: Narrative & Visualization

focus: Interactive explainers for policy and outreach

stories.quote: We prototyped a salivary biosensor in four weeks because the data team built the calibration models in parallel with wet-lab validation.
stories.author: Ananya Sharma

stories.quote: Animating protein interactions with shaders helped us explain our findings to clinicians without a single slide deck.
stories.author: Madhav Negi

stories.quote: KBG is where I learned to pair lab notebooks with reproducible code — our audits are now faster and our science more transparent.
stories.author: Priya Kapoor

contact.headline: Let’s build something bio × AI
contact.description: Ping us with project ideas, collaboration requests, or to host a workshop. We’re always looking for new voices, datasets, and lab challenges to remix.
